title: 17.3 The Potential Method
content:
Section 17.3

The Potential Method

Summary

Define potential function, amortized cost = actual + ΔΦ.

Key Points

  • Φ(D): potential function mapping data structure state to number
  • Amortized cost: ĉᵢ = cᵢ + Φ(Dᵢ) - Φ(Dᵢ₋₁)
  • Sum of amortized = sum of actual + Φ(Dₙ) - Φ(D₀)
  • If Φ(Dₙ) ≥ Φ(D₀), amortized ≥ actual (what we want)
  • Art: choosing the right potential function

Example

Stack potential = number of items. PUSH: actual 1, Φ increases by 1, amortized = 2. POP: actual 1, Φ decreases by 1, amortized = 0.

Why It Matters

Most powerful and general amortized analysis technique.
